paper_abstract: In 2004, Chang and Chang proposed a three-party encrypted key exchange (ECC-3PEKE) protocol without using the server's public keys. They claimed that their proposed ECC-3PEKE protocol is secure, efficient, and practical. Unlike their claims, the ECC-3PEKE protocol, however, is still susceptible to undetectable on-line password guessing attacks. Accordingly, the current paper demonstrates the vulnerability of Chang-Chang's ECC-3PEKE protocol regarding undetectable on-line password guessing attacks and than presents an enhancement to resolve such security problems. paper_title: Improving the novel three-party encrypted key exchange protocol
